metadata.title: CVE-2014-8086 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Race condition in the ext4_file_write_iter function in fs/ext4/file.c inthe Linux kernel through 3.17 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (file unavailability) via a combination of a write action and anF_SETFL fcntl operation for the O_DIRECT flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-lowlatency - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-26-generic - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
